comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: You can touch them up on this device: https://herbivoracious.com/2012/10/the-best-way-to-sharpen-your-knives-at-home.html - but if they are badly dull, you have to take them to a professional.

comments.author: Sandy
comments.content:
Hey Michael,

That's a great video on how to sharpen knives using steel.

I know with experience that it requires a lot of practice to ensure that you get the angle right. That's when you will actually get your knives sharpened.

Else, as you suggested - it's a good bet to go with the electric knife sharpener

comments.author: Robert
comments.content: This makes no sense, I have been told two distinct ways of how to hone a knife; going against the blade and going with the blade of the knife. In his paper description would you not then want to bend that overlapping potion back by dragging the blade of the knife away and against the honing steel and not pushing it with it?
